node.excerpt: Fuzz FuzzingÂ orÂ fuzz testingÂ is an automatedÂ software testingÂ technique that involves providing invalid, unexpected, orÂ random dataÂ as inputs to aÂ computer program. The program is then monitored for exceptions such asÂ crashes, failing built-in codeÂ assertions, or potentialÂ memory leaks. Typically, fuzzers are used to test programs that take structured inputs. This structure is specified, e.g., in aÂ file formatÂ orÂ protocolÂ and distinguishes valid from invalid input. An effective fuzzer generatesâ€¦
